reviews.review_msg:
Worst. Class. Ever.
 
 Joan is a terrible professor... I really don't know how she is teaching at this level. I've had Ph.D. students teach better than her. All she does is go up to the front of the class, open her book and read. She also goes very fast.
 
 The class it self isn't too hard though. Skip the lectures and concentrate on the book.
Great prof, great material, fair exams

His lectures are very interesting and he keeps it lighthearted. The midterm exam was so easy he used questions he provided in the sample midterm for us beforehand and a lot of it was based on the lecture.

This class is pretty tough. Lots of readings but he provides good lecture slides. Midterm and final are really hard, but he lets you bring in one cheat sheet for the mid term and two cheat sheets for the final.  The legal research assignment and the two other assignments plus tutorial participation should help boost your mark though
This prof really cares about his student's doing well.  Great guy to take the class from, made it interesting and relevant
Super approachable, helpful, clear, organized, and most of all SO FUN! It would be a mistake to leave SFU without taking a course with her first. The gem of the criminology department :)
